info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:17AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH FREQUENT LIGHTNING AND HEAVY RAINFALL LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON... Scattered to numerous thunderstorms are expected to impact much of Southeast South Carolina and Southeast Georgia this afternoon as hot and very humid conditions continue. Any thunderstorms that develop will be slow moving and will have the potential to drop a quick 1 to 2 inches of rain in a very short period. This may result in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. Frequent cloud-to-ground lightning will also occur. Anyone participating in outdoor activities should remain alert for lightning. If you can hear thunder, then you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Lightning can strike many miles from a thunderstorm. Being struck by lightning can cause injuries or even death. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio All Hazards or the Internet for the latest information from the National Weather Service.
